column4: Any idea how to restore my HD? I installed GNOME on 12.04 and it wiped my drive.
After rebooting grub errors.
I'd use your backups
Explain.
data important to you wil have been copied to a removable storage by you, or to another system for safe keeping....a backup
so if anything bad happens, you can restore the data
It was a fresh install. After installing GNOME it got wiped.
can you expand on 'wiped' please
a default 12.04 Ubuntu install comes with Gnome desktop by default
Isn't unity different?
yes, Unity isa shell for the gnome desktop
it replaces Gnome-panel as the default shell
so...how do you mean 'wiped'  you never said
not seeing anything overly exciting there
what do you see when you log in?
I can't login. Grub errored
then boot to liveCD and reinstate grub2
I use a 12.04 Live CD and see that my partitions have been wiped.
nothing is wiped at all, just the grub is faulty
as in no partitions?
is it an SSD?
you could use testdisk to make the same partitions and fsck them (assuming you know the sizes)
I know how large they were, but not exactly for one of them
